meanings.sent1: She was not brooking any excuses for being late to class.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was brooking no disruptions during the exam.
meanings.sent3: The strict librarian was brooking no noise in the library.
meanings.sent4: The mother brooked no arguments when it came to bedtime.
meanings.sent5: The boss was brooking no laziness in the workplace.

meanings.definition: To endure or put up with
meanings.sent1: Despite the rain, the hikers were brooking the challenging trail.
meanings.sent2: She was brooking the long wait at the doctor's office with patience.
meanings.sent3: The cat was brooking the playful antics of the new puppy.
meanings.sent4: He was brooking the pain of his injury with a brave face.
meanings.sent5: The student was brooking the difficult assignment with determination.

meanings.sent1: The old tree was brooking the weight of the heavy snow on its branches.
meanings.sent2: She was brooking the loss of her beloved pet with tears in her eyes.
meanings.sent3: The soldier was brooking the wounds of battle with courage.
meanings.sent4: The patient was brooking the discomfort of the medical procedure.
meanings.sent5: The athlete was brooking the pain of the intense workout.

meanings.sent1: He was brooking the responsibility of leading the team with confidence.
meanings.sent2: The chef was brooking the pressure of cooking for a large event.
meanings.sent3: The student was brooking the challenge of the difficult math problem.
meanings.sent4: The manager was brooking the demands of the busy workday.
meanings.sent5: The parent was brooking the chaos of the children's playdate.
